title: Minimize/close to tray
body:
So, I know the current focus of the LCU is to get on par with the AIR client and not add new features just yet, but as you mentioned, one of the goals of rebuilding the client is to make it so that people do not think it's too RAM-consuming and close the client, or in other words, so that they can let it run in the background with no qualms. With that in mind, are there any plans to add an option to close the client to the tray instead of shutting it down completely?
Though I don't know whether you use Electron, Node.js or something homemade, I think all two are able to manage that just fine.

Of course, that would imply some form of notifications on the desktop whenever you are invited to a game or receive a message. Windows has that since XP (for instance, Discord which is based on Electron uses the default Windows notifications), I don't think OS X has anything similar, but just as Chrome or Vivaldi (Node.js again) use their own legacy notifications, I suppose it's possible to use your own system and have rich notifications instead of the simple Windows ones.

So, the question was originally: are there any plans for that? I don't mind my League client running in the background but I like keeping my workspace clean, and one window less when I'm alt-tabbing is always welcome.

replies.body:
by default the classic client goes to try when the game starts but if you call it when you minimize it it does not goes to tray again

i think this option should be included that the minimize button sends the launcher to tray. You don't need it in the taskbar

> So, the question was originally: are there any plans for that?

There is nothing in specific that I can share with you right now. Everything you mentioned are things that have been talked about. We are definitely thinking about those features, but no decisions have been made yet.

I love it! With the AIR client I was always wondering why it could minimize to tray automatically in game, but not on command. Minimizing to tray is one of my favorite features of any app.
